title: How come East Asian cultural exports have gotten so big, but South Asian culture hasn't? - Quora

response.answer_text: Haven’t you heard about ‘Bollywood’ in India? The population of India would be over 1.4 billion people; it is one of the top domestic markets in terms of cultural commodities, including movie, TV, and so forth. India’s cultural power and influence are huge enough to meet not only domestic needs but also around the world. The movie industry so-called ‘Bollywood’ would be an excellent example to prove it. Basically, East Asia 3 countries are the countries based on export using their active assembly-manufacturing systems, also have long relationships with the English oriented markets. So, it looks like these countries achieved significant exports, also seems to be cultural exports are overwhelming other Asian regions. South Asian culture and market also huge enough not to be underestimated.

East Asian cultural exports haven’t gotten ‘so big’ Most westerners could not name one contemporary East Asian TV program, movie or book. There is K-Pop but that is nothing like as big as its fans like to make out. In global terms South Asian culture is actually bigger.
